One of China's national scenic resorts, the 90-square-mile Jingpo Lake sits 110 km south of Mudanjiang City and, at an altitude of 350 meters above sea level, is China's largest alpine lake. Spring flowers, summer waterfalls, autumn leaves, and winter snows have produced 8 scenic spots around the lake.
Direct bus from Mudanjiang leaves in morning and returns in afternoon.

value: Fishing season is from June to August
Dixia Senlin (Underground Forest)- located 31 miles away from the National Park, delicate ecosystem that survives on the fertile soil of 10 dormant volcanic craters
